Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.1: WASTE FACILITY IDENFITIER: unique identifier for the support facility.
Column Comment.2: WASTE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the waste information about a facility.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: WASTE ADJUSTMENT REASON: The reason for an adjustemnet between theshipped and received volume, such as temperature based shrinkage or expansion,spillage, evaporation etc.
Column Comment.5: ADJUSTMENT AMOUNT: The amount of the adjustment between the amountshipped and the amount received. This may be calculated.
Column Comment.8: AMOUNT RECEIVED: The amount of waste actually received by the waste handlingfacility.
Column Comment.11: AMOUNT SHIPPED: the amount of waste material that was shipped.
Column Comment.14: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.15: DESCRIPTION: A textual description of the service for waste handling.
Column Comment.16: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.17: RECEIVED DATE: The date that the waste material was received.
Column Comment.18: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.19: OPEATOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the businessassociate who is the operator for this service.
Column Comment.20: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.21: ORIGIN FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data,such as pipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventuallybecome a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.22: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.23: ORIGIN WELL UWI: Unique identifier for the well.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: PROVISION ID: unique identifier for a contract provision
Column Comment.26: RATE AND FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided. .
Column Comment.27: RECEIVER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate who received the waste material.
Column Comment.28: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.29: REPORTING UNIT OF MEASURE: The unit of measure that these amounts must beconverted to for reporting.
Column Comment.30: SERVICE QUALITY: The quality of service provided.
Column Comment.31: SERVICE TYPE: The type of waste disposal service offered, such as hauling,incineration, burial etc.
Column Comment.32: SHIPPED DATE: The date this waste material was shipped from its place of origin.
Column Comment.33: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.34: TRANSPORT BA ID: The business associate who provided the transport of thematerial.
Column Comment.35: WASTE HANDLING METHOD: The method used to handle disposal of the wastematerial, such as incineration, neutralization, burying etc.
Column Comment.36: WASTE HAZARD: The hazardous nature of the material, such as dangerous goods.
Column Comment.37: WASTE MATERIAL: The material that has been shipped as waste, such as drill mud.
Column Comment.38: FACILITY WASTE ORIGIN TYPE: The type of location that this waste originatedfrom, such as facility or well.
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.40: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.42: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.45: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
